text: Actinolepis is an extinct genus of actinolepidH. G. Johnson, D. K. Elliott, and J. H. Wittke. 2000. A new actinolepid arthrodire (Class Placodermi) from the Lower Devonian Sevy Dolomite, east-central Nevada. Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society 129(2):241-266 [P. Wagner/P. Wagner/P. Wagner] placoderm from the Early Devonian. Four species are known: A. magna from Estonia,R. Denison. 1978. Placodermi. In H.-P. Schultze (ed.), Handbook of Palaeoichthyology 2:1-128 [W. Dahdul/B. Frable /G. Lloyd] A. spinosa from Latvia (Sevy Dolomite), the type species A. tuberculata from New Zealand (Adam Mudstone Formation)http://www.palaeos.org/Actinolepidae and A. zaikai from Belarus (Lepel Beds). ==Gallery== Estonian Museum of Natural History Specimen No 203503 photo (g204 g204-1 jpg).jpg|300px|Fragmentary dorsal armour of A. magna (specimen EMNH 203503); housed at the Estonian Museum of Natural History == References == Category:Devonian placoderms Category:Arthrodires Category:Placoderm families Category:Early Devonian first appearances Category:Early Devonian extinctions
title: Actinolepis (placoderm)
